report.title: Explore records 2
report.description: Report designed for the explore records facility in iRecord, with additional parameters. This must be used alongside Explore records 2 mapping if maps are required. Uses a spatial intersection to determine the records in the supplied boundary.
report.query: SELECT #columns# FROM cache_occurrences o JOIN websites w on w.id=o.website_id #agreements_join# #joins# WHERE #sharing_filter# AND o.record_status not in ('I','T') AND (#ownData#=1 OR o.record_status not in ('D','R')) #idlist#

param.name: smpattrs
param.description: Comma separated list of sample attribute IDs to include

param.name: occattrs
param.description: Comma separated list of occurrence attribute IDs to include

param.name: idlist
param.description: Comma separated list of occurrence IDs to filter to.

param.name: currentUser
param.description: Current user's warehouse ID. Allows a column to be output indicating that the user owns the record.

param.name: location_id
param.description: Provide the location to display records for

param.name: ownLocality
param.join: JOIN locations lfilter ON st_intersects(coalesce(lfilter.boundary_geom, lfilter.centroid_geom), o.public_geom) AND lfilter.id=#location_id#

param.name: taxon_groups
param.description: List of taxon group IDs to view data for

param.name: survey_id
param.description: Select the survey, or leave for all surveys

param.name: date_from
param.where: ('#date_from#'='Click here' OR o.date_end >= CAST(COALESCE('#date_from#','1500-01-01') as date))

param.name: date_to
param.where: ('#date_to#'='Click here' OR o.date_start <= CAST(COALESCE('#date_to#','1500-01-01') as date))

column.name: taxon
column.sql: CASE WHEN o.preferred_taxon=o.default_common_name then o.preferred_taxon ELSE o.preferred_taxon || COALESCE(' | ' || o.default_common_name, '') END

column.name: recorder
column.sql: CASE WHEN w.id IN (#website_ids#) THEN '' ELSE w.title || '-> ' END || CASE WHEN LENGTH(o.recorders)>30 THEN 'Recorder' ELSE o.recorders END

column.name: belongs_to_user
column.sql: CASE WHEN CAST(o.created_by_id AS character varying) = '#currentUser#' AND o.website_id IN (#website_ids#) THEN true ELSE false END

column.name: input_form
column.sql: case when o.input_form is null then '#default_input_form#' else o.input_form end
